properties.text: At times onset, man was beset With constant toil and regret His only tools to work the land Were sweat of brow, grip of hand, And the sweet tunes of his favorite band
And then, through causes none yet know, The powers of some did greatly grow… Some could move the earth with ease And others could the flames appease Yet others call a healing breeze
And though their lot had once been tragic All changed with the advent of magic Men who once were weak and poor Men who had it all and more Oh, and women, lest we war…
Though magics coming as a whole Helped commoner and noble There were still few who liked it best When in times past the rest had less And they had someone to oppress
And so, man did what he does best And squandered his arcane largesse It all started one dark night Where colluding minds explored their plight And plotted the opposite of right which would be evil…
